channel.title: Runescape Loader
channel.description:
Hello, I am attempting to make a Runescape Loader. I have successfully made an applet that will load the specified runescape.jar.
The problem I am having is that I wish to load the saved preferences and cache that are on the user's computer. Such as graphics settings, sound settings, etc.
I was looking at this http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,55301.20.html but I was unsure what [code]cg = injectObject(cg, "java.applet.Applet",f.getName(), "getClient");[/code] was doing.
Any help on this matter would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: Runescape Loader
item.dc:creator: @Killer-99-pkz Killer-99-pkz
item.description:
@Killer-99-pkz wrote:

heres an idea, load the loader up like you load the rs jar and initialize it let that do the dirty work then gain access to the classloader via the Canvas which you can listen for, then you have the entire thing at your fingertips. but in order to use librarys like bcel to “hook” your requested items you would need to reload the rs pack200 jar saved in the cache (main_file_cache.dat3) load it with they’re class loader (hook it with simple constructor searching) make the new instance then you have access to it all (to get all of the classes in a list just access the hashtable where its all stored then discard the unpacker) easyer done then sed.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Loader
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

i am relatively new to the cheating scene, so your '06 stage is most likely my current stage regarding knowledge of the client. and i agree with you on how we can find factors that can be detected, but in that case, prove to me that this way of loading the client is detectable (im not saying its not since it most likely is, but i have yet to see how it is)

and what i posted today is different than that what you interpreted my post to be…

[quote=“abraham2119, post:16, topic:302017”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=398352.msg2956847#msg2956847 date=1252880544]
Mind your language, children use this forum.

I assumed, as you stated:

if you want to find which classes to replace in other revisions, simply look in loader.run() and there will be 5 statements

Thus promoting the fact that you think this is a good idea,
if you didnt think it was a good idea you would have posted something similar to what i did.

I offer help to those people who ask, i am not going to publically release code anymore as i have seen where that has got me, no-where.

and if what you are saying,

i just let him know how to figure out which classes to replace

Then you are promoting bad practice? very smart of you. you obviously care about the cheating community very much so you provide people with bad information to deter them from the correct. I have read many of your posts over the past week or so, never posted a response to any despite me having to restrain myself from your idiocy, I can now see why so many people get frustrated by you. You fail, and bad. my advice to you is to delete your account change ISP and re-create a new account, chaning your attitude along the way, this will please atlease 90% of the active MITB users.

p.s. dont reply with “you are an idiot” or “i hate you”, i dont care.
rep–

[/quote]so basically you are assuming that i promote this way of loading a signed client based on the fact that i am stating where he can find the classes that the loader.jar replaces?[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Loader
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

just a side note to op: if you want to find which classes to replace in other revisions, simply look in loader.run() and there will be 5 statements as so:

Class.forName(..); <invoke> Class.forName(..); <invoke> Class.forName(..); <invoke> Class.forName(..); <invoke> Class.forName(..); <invoke>

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Loader
item.dc:creator: @jimmy5410 jimmy5410
item.description:
@jimmy5410 wrote:

[quote=“Howso57, post:6, topic:302017”]Ok so I want to stick with runescape.jar

What would I need to put into the provideSignlink method?[/quote]

Alright. You’ll need to start off by replacing a few of the classes in the client with the ones from the loader.jar. In the 562 client, these classes are

an ud or va mf
You replace these classes, because that’s what the loader.jar does (look in the run() method of the loader class). You can then start your client normally, but because you’ve replaced these classes, you must invoke the provideSignlink() method. This can be done by adding the following code right after you create a new instance of the client class (and right before you set the applet’s stub).

Class signlinkClass = this.classLoader.loadClass(SIGNLINK); Constructor<?> signlinkConstructor = signlinkClass.getConstructors()[0]; Object signlinkInitialized = signlinkConstructor.newInstance(APPLET, 32, "runescape",29); client.getMethod("providesignlink", new Class[] { signlinkClass }).invoke(null, new Object[] { signlinkInitialized });
Where SIGNLINK is the name of the signlink class (in the 562 client, ud), and APPLET is your new instance of the client class cast as an applet. The above code comes from the run() method of the loader class.

If you didn’t screw this up, then you should have a working signed client.

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape Loader
item.dc:creator: @jimmy5410 jimmy5410
item.description:
@jimmy5410 wrote:

Howso57:

How would i go about signing the jar?

Use the loader.jar instead of runescape.jar, or replace the classes and invoke the provideSignlink() method manually.

Read full topic
